title: Anthony Kennedy
added: On August 4, 2010, [[Dahlia Lithwick]] wrote about Judge [[Vaughn R. Walker]]'s ruling that overturned California's [[California Proposition 8|Proposition 8]] banning same-sex marriage, Walker "is not Anthony Kennedy. But when the chips are down, he certainly knows how to write like him. I count—in his opinion today—seven citations to Justice Kennedy's 1996 opinion in ''Romer v. Evans'' ... and eight citations to his 2003 decision in ''Lawrence v. Texas'' ... In a stunning decision this afternoon ... Walker trod heavily on the path Kennedy has blazed on gay rights."<ref>{{cite web|title=A Brilliant Ruling|url=http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/jurisprudence/2010/08/a_brilliant_ruling.html|work=Slate|accessdate=March 23, 2012|author=Dahlia Lithwick|date=August 4, 2010}}</ref> The next day, Lithwick said on ABC's ''[[Good Morning America]]'', "Walker's ruling that California's ban on same-sex marriage is unconstitutional was aimed at one man: Justice Anthony Kennedy."<ref>{{cite news|title=Proposition 8 Ruling Takes Aim at Justice Kenedy|url=https://abcnews.go.com/blogs/politics/2010/08/proposition-8-ruling-takes-aim-at-justice-kennedy/|publisher=ABC News|accessdate=March 23, 2012}}</ref>
